= get_post_complete =

_object_ *get_post_complete*( integer _$id_ ) 

This gets a _complete_ post, including all custom fields.

=== $id ===
(integer) (required) The ID of the post whose data you want.

== Example ==

{{{
<?php $my_post = get_post_complete(123); ?>
<a href="<?php print $my_post->guid; ?>"><?php print $my_post->post_title; ?></a>
<?php print $my_post->my_custom_field; ?>
}}}

== Example2 ==

You can also use this function to help grab all of a post's custom fields in a loop:

{{{
$results = get_posts(array('post_type'=>'book'));

foreach($results as $r) {
	$r = get_post_complete($r->ID);
	print $r->post_title;
	print $r->my_custom_field;
	print_r($r); // <-- prints out all available fields, both built-in and custom fields
}
}}}
